name: Twitchin
description: As a regulator of muscle movement, this protein helps to keep worms wiggling!

name: TMM
description: This protein is called “too many mouths” and helps make cells that allow plants to breath.

name: Sorcin
description: With the metal Calcium as a companion, this protein keeps the hearts of Chinese hamsters happy and beating.

name: vNGF
description: This little growth factor is needed to help neurons to grow and keeps the Chinese cobra thinking and feeling.

name: GLRA1
description: As a key controller of how excited neurons can get, this protein makes sure that zebrafish swim sensibly.

name: Aquaporin-5
description: Like a biological hole punch, this protein helps to keep us happy and hydrated by controlling how much water is let into cells.

name: Rptor
description: This protein helps to make other proteins, which keep mouse cells moving and shaking!

name: SLIT-ROBO
description: This protein keeps one of the building blocks of life on its toes, which helps neurons to grow and ensures we sense our environments.

name: Timeless
description: Time is always on its side for this protein, and its reputation means it’s always wanted and needed to make sure hearts are ticking along nicely.

name: Brick1
description: This protein helps to keep the parts of the cell where they need to and means that whether you are a human or slime mold, your cells are strong and stable.

name: Batman
description: Did you know that flies have a protein called Batman? As in the comic books, Batman in flies also has a trusty sidekick; together with Trl, Batman attaches to DNA and for the good of fly-kind, controls which proteins are made.

name: Fandango
description: Does the fandango protein know how to fandango? Or is the fandango protein more of a faint sausage? Whatever it’s secrets may be, this protein helps to put the building blocks of a protein together.
